novice.question: What does HTML stand for?

What does CSS stand for?

Which property is used to change the background color?

Which operator is used to assign a value to a variable?

How can you make a numbered list?
What is the correct HTML for inserting an image?

What is the default value of the position property?

How do you select elements with class name 'test'?

What is the correct HTML for making a text input field?

How do you display hyperlinks without an underline?
Which property is used to change the left margin of an element?

JavaScript is the same as Java.
How do you write 'Hello World' in an alert box?

How do you call a function named 'myFunction'?

How to write an IF statement for executing code if 'i' is NOT equal to 5?
How does a WHILE loop start?
How does a FOR loop start?

Which tag is used for a multi-line text input?

easy.question: What is the difference between '==' and '===' in JavaScript?
options: == checks value, === checks value and type

easy.question: What is the CSS Box Model?
What does 'z-index' do?
options: Controls the stack order of elements
Changes the width of an element

easy.question: What is the purpose of 'rem' units in CSS?
options: Relative to the font-size of the root element

easy.question: How do you center a div horizontally using Flexbox?
What is a 'Media Query' used for?
options: Applying styles based on device characteristics (width, etc.)

easy.question: Which keyword is used to declare a block-scoped variable in JS?
What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in ?
options: SEO and accessibility for screen readers

easy.question: What does 'Float' do in CSS?
options: Pushes an element to the left or right of its container

easy.question: Which array method adds an element to the end of an array?
Which array method removes the first element?
What is 'Hoisting' in JavaScript?
options: Moving declarations to the top of their scope

easy.question: What is the purpose of the 'map()' method?
options: Creating a new array by performing a function on each element

easy.question: What does the 'display: none' property do?
options: Removes the element from the document flow
Hides it but keeps the space

easy.question: What is the difference between 'visibility: hidden' and 'display: none'?
options: Hidden keeps the space, None removes it
None keeps the space, Hidden removes it
Hidden is for text, None for blocks

easy.question: How do you select the first child of a div in CSS?
What is a 'Template Literal' in JS?
options: String literals allowing embedded expressions with backticks

easy.question: What is the purpose of 'localStorage'?
options: Persistent data storage in the browser

easy.question: What is the 'DOMContentLoaded' event?
options: When the HTML document has been completely loaded and parsed
When the user clicks the page

easy.question: What is a 'Pseudo-class' in CSS?
options: Keyword added to a selector to specify a special state (e.g., :hover)

easy.question: Which property is used to align items vertically in a flex container?
What is the purpose of the 'transition' property?
options: Animating the change of CSS properties

easy.question: What is a 'Promise' in JavaScript?
options: An object representing completion or failure of an async operation

easy.question: What is the purpose of 'JSON.stringify()'?
options: Convert a JS object to a JSON string

easy.question: What does 'Async/Await' do?
options: Handles asynchronous code in a synchronous manner

easy.question: What is a 'Callback' function?
options: A function that calls back the server
A function passed into another function as an argument

easy.question: What is 'Destructuring' in JS?
options: Extracting data from arrays or objects into distinct variables

easy.question: What is the purpose of 'overflow: hidden'?
options: Clips content that overflows an element's box

easy.question: What is a 'CSS Preprocessor'?
options: A tool that extends CSS with variables/functions (e.g., SCSS)

easy.question: Which HTML element is used to define navigation links?
What is the 'this' keyword in JS?
options: Refers to the object it belongs to
Refers to the global scope always

easy.question: What is a 'NodeList'?
options: A collection of nodes returned by methods like querySelectorAll

easy.question: What is 'Event Bubbling'?
options: Events propagating from child to parent

easy.question: What is 'event.preventDefault()' used for?
options: Stopping the default browser action (e.g., link click)

easy.question: What is the purpose of 'vh' and 'vw' units?
options: Percentage of viewport height and width

easy.question: What is a 'Web Worker'?
options: A script running in the background independently of the user interface

easy.question: What is 'Responsive Design'?
options: Design that adapts to different screen sizes

easy.question: What is a 'Pull Request'?
options: A request to merge code changes into a branch

easy.question: What is 'Transpilation' (e.g., Babel)?
options: Converting source code from one high-level language to another (e.g., ES6 to ES5)

easy.question: What is the purpose of 'SVG'?
options: Scalable Vector Graphics for resolution-independent images

easy.question: Which property is used for creating a shadow behind text?

intermediate.question: What is a 'Closure' in JavaScript?
options: A function bundled with its lexical environment

intermediate.question: What is the 'Virtual DOM'?
options: A lightweight representation of the real DOM used by frameworks like React

intermediate.question: What is the 'Module Pattern' in JS?
options: A design pattern to encapsulate private and public members

intermediate.question: What is 'Debouncing'?
options: Grouping multiple calls to a function into one after a delay

intermediate.question: What is 'Throttling'?
options: Limiting the number of times a function can be called over a period

intermediate.question: What is 'Higher-Order Component' (HOC) in React?
options: A function that takes a component and returns a new one
A component that renders a list

intermediate.question: What is 'TypeScript'?
options: A typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JS

intermediate.question: What is the 'Critical Rendering Path'?
options: Sequence of steps the browser takes to convert HTML/CSS/JS into pixels

intermediate.question: What is 'Hydration' in SSR?
options: Attaching event listeners to server-rendered HTML

intermediate.question: What is the 'Shadow DOM'?
options: A hidden version of the site
An encapsulated version of the DOM for web components

intermediate.question: What is 'Currying' in functional programming?
options: Transforming a function with multiple args into a sequence of functions

intermediate.question: What is 'Memoization'?
options: Caching the results of expensive function calls

intermediate.question: What is 'Tree Shaking'?
options: Removing unused code from a bundle

intermediate.question: What is 'Content Security Policy' (CSP)?
options: A security layer that helps detect and mitigate certain types of attacks like XSS

intermediate.question: What is 'Lighthouse' in Chrome?
options: An automated tool for improving the quality of web pages

intermediate.question: What is the purpose of 'webpack'?
options: A static module bundler for modern JS apps

intermediate.question: What is 'Tree-walking' in the DOM?
options: The process of visiting all nodes in a tree

intermediate.question: What is the 'Intersection Observer API'?
options: Providing a way to asynchronously observe changes in intersection of element with ancestor/viewport

intermediate.question: What are 'React Hooks'?
options: Functions that let you 'hook into' React state and lifecycle features from function components

intermediate.question: What is 'useCallback' hook used for?
options: Memoizing a callback function to prevent unnecessary renders

intermediate.question: What is 'Next.js'?
options: A JavaScript framework for React applications

intermediate.question: What is the 'Flux' architecture?
options: A pattern for managing data flow in applications

intermediate.question: What is 'Prop Drilling'?
options: Passing data through many levels of components to reach a deep one

intermediate.question: What is 'Context API' in React?
options: A way to share data across components without prop drilling

intermediate.question: What is 'Atomic Design'?
options: A methodology for creating design systems

intermediate.question: What is 'Lazy Loading'?
options: Delaying initialization of resource until it is needed

intermediate.question: What is 'Code Splitting'?
options: Dividing code into various bundles which can be loaded on demand

intermediate.question: What is 'Preload' vs 'Prefetch'?
options: Preload is for current page, Prefetch for future navigation
Prefetch is for current page, Preload for future

intermediate.question: What is 'HTTP/2'?
options: A major revision of the HTTP network protocol

intermediate.question: What is 'WebSockets'?
options: A communication protocol for full-duplex communication over a single TCP connection

intermediate.question: What is 'Serverless Functions' (e.g., Vercel Functions)?
options: Event-driven code that runs in managed environments

intermediate.question: What is 'Accessibility' (A11y)?
options: Ensuring web content is usable by everyone regardless of ability

intermediate.question: What is 'Contrast Ratio'?
options: Difference in luminance between foreground and background

intermediate.question: What is 'Responsive Images' (e.g., srcset)?
options: Serving different image sizes based on device capabilities

intermediate.question: What is the 'Event Loop' in JavaScript?
options: A mechanism that allows JS to perform non-blocking I/O operations

master.question: How does the 'V8' engine handle JavaScript?
options: Compiles to bytecode then machine code via JIT

master.question: What is the 'Prototype Chain'?
options: A mechanism for objects to inherit features from one another

master.question: What are 'Generators' in JS?
options: Functions that can be exited and later re-entered

master.question: What is 'Tail Call Optimization'?
options: The ability for a function call to not create a new stack frame

master.question: What is the 'Shadow DOM' boundary?
options: Encapsulation between the component and the light DOM

master.question: What is 'Strict Mode' in JS?
options: A way to opt in to a restricted variant of JavaScript

master.question: What is 'Monomorphic' vs 'Polymorphic' code in V8?
options: Code that operates on one vs multiple hidden classes

master.question: What is 'Garbage Collection: Scavenge' in V8?
options: Young generation collection using Cheney's algorithm

master.question: What is 'WeakMap' vs 'Map' in JS?
options: WeakMap allows garbage collection of keys if they aren't referenced elsewhere

master.question: What is the 'Reflect' API?
options: A built-in object that provides methods for interceptable JS operations

master.question: What is a 'Proxy' object in JS?
options: An object that allows you to intercept and customize operations for another object

master.question: What is 'WebAssembly' (Wasm)?
options: A binary instruction format for a stack-based virtual machine

master.question: What is 'IndexedDB'?
options: A low-level API for client-side storage of large amounts of structured data

master.question: What is 'Resource Prioritization' (e.g., fetchpriority)?
options: Indicating the relative importance of a resource to the browser

master.question: What is the 'Compositor Thread' in browsers?
options: A thread responsible for drawing parts of the page separately

master.question: What is 'Layout Thrashing'?
options: Repeatedly reading and writing to the DOM, forcing synchronous layouts

master.question: What is 'Passive Event Listeners'?
options: Listeners that indicate they will not call preventDefault() for scroll performance

master.question: What is 'React Fiber'?
options: A complete rewrite of the React reconciliation algorithm

master.question: What is 'Concurrent Mode' in React?
options: A set of new features that help React apps stay responsive

master.question: What is 'Portals' in React?
options: A way to render children into a DOM node that exists outside the hierarchy

master.question: What is 'Zustand'?
options: A small, fast, and scalable bearbones state-management solution

master.question: What is 'TanStack Query' (React Query)?
options: A data-fetching and state management library for TS/JS

master.question: What is 'Storybook'?
options: A tool for developing UI components in isolation

master.question: What is 'Isomorphic JavaScript'?
options: JavaScript that runs on both the client and the server

master.question: What is 'Hydration Mismatch'?
options: Difference between the server-rendered HTML and client-rendered content

master.question: What is 'Edge Computing' (e.g., Cloudflare Workers)?
options: Running code geographically close to users

master.question: What is 'Brotli' compression?
options: A data format used for HTTP compression, more efficient than Gzip

master.question: What is 'Atomic CSS'?
options: A style of CSS architecture where each selector has one property (e.g., Tailwind)

master.question: What is 'Contentful Paint' (FCP vs LCP)?
options: First vs Largest Contentful Paint metrics

master.question: What is 'CLS' in Core Web Vitals?
What is 'FID' and 'INP'?
options: First Input Delay and Interaction to Next Paint
Fast Input Data and Internal Network Path

master.question: What is 'Synthetic Events' in React?
options: Cross-browser wrappers around the browser's native event

master.question: What is 'Strict DOM'?
options: The idea of limiting DOM access to specific patterns

master.question: What is 'Custom Elements'?
options: A way to define your own HTML tags

master.question: What is 'HTML Templates' (<template>)?
options: A mechanism for holding client-side content that is not rendered on load

master.question: What is 'Container Queries' in CSS?
options: Styles based on the size of a parent container rather than viewport

master.question: What is 'Layering' in CSS (@layer)?
options: A way to manage style precedence and cascade

master.question: What is 'CSS Variables' scoping?
options: Variables can be scoped to specific selectors or inheritance

master.question: What is 'SMACSS'?
options: Scalable and Modular Architecture for CSS

master.question: What is 'Functional CSS'?
options: A methodology of building UI with utility classes

master.question: What is 'Component-Driven Development'?
options: Building UIs from the bottom up starting with components

master.question: What is 'Mono-repo' (e.g., Turborepo, Nx)?
options: A repository containing multiple distinct projects/packages

master.question: What is 'LSP' (Language Server Protocol)?
options: Protocol for communication between editors and language servers

expert.question: What is the 'Composite Layer' hierarchy?
options: How the browser organizes painted elements to reduce redraws

expert.question: What is 'TCP Slow Start' impact on frontend?
options: Limit on initial data packets sent over a connection

expert.question: What is 'QUIC' and 'HTTP/3'?
options: A UDP-based transport protocol for faster web performance

expert.question: What is 'Speculative Rules API'?
options: Letting the browser predict and pre-render likely next navigations

expert.question: What is 'Island Architecture'?
options: A technique to hydrate specific interactive parts of a page

expert.question: What is 'Resumability' (e.g., Qwik framework)?
options: Instantly becoming interactive without full re-hydration

expert.question: What is 'View Transitions API'?
options: A native way to create seamless transitions between DOM states

expert.question: What is 'Paint Holding'?
options: Browser feature that prevents a blank screen during navigation

expert.question: What is 'Content-visibility' property?
options: Allows the browser to skip rendering work for off-screen elements

expert.question: What is 'SIMD' in WebAssembly?
options: Single Instruction, Multiple Data for parallel processing

expert.question: What is 'SharedArrayBuffer' and 'Atomics'?
options: Ways to share memory between threads (Workers) safely

expert.question: What is 'OffscreenCanvas'?
options: A canvas that can be rendered without a DOM in a worker

expert.question: What is 'Houdini' (CSS API)?
options: A set of low-level APIs that give developers access to browser's CSS engine

expert.question: What is 'Paint Worklet'?
options: A way to programmatically draw images for CSS properties

expert.question: What is 'Layout Worklet'?
options: A way to define custom layout algorithms in the browser

expert.question: What is 'Workbox'?
options: A collection of libraries to simplify Service Worker development

expert.question: What is 'HTTP/2 Server Push' issues?
options: Potential for wasted bandwidth if browser already has the resource

expert.question: What is 'Priority Hints' (importance attribute)?
options: Telling the browser the relative priority of a resource

expert.question: What is 'BFC' (Block Formatting Context)?
options: A part of visual CSS rendering of a web page

expert.question: What is 'Stale-While-Revalidate' (SWR)?
options: A caching strategy to return cached data then update in background

expert.question: What is 'Microtask' vs 'Macrotask'?
options: Categories of async tasks in the JS event loop

expert.question: What is 'V8 Optimization: Inlining'?
options: Replacing a function call with its body content

expert.question: What is 'Hidden Classes' in V8?
options: A mechanism V8 uses to optimize access to object properties

expert.question: What is 'Deoptimization' in JS engines?
options: When V8 falls back to the interpreter because assumptions were wrong

expert.question: What is 'Typed Arrays' (e.g., Float64Array)?
options: Handling raw binary data in the browser

expert.question: What is 'WebGPU'?
options: A new API for low-level graphics and compute on the GPU

expert.question: What is 'WebXR'?
options: API for creating VR and AR experiences in the browser

expert.question: What is 'Cross-Origin Opener Policy' (COOP)?
options: A security header to isolate your origin from others

expert.question: What is 'Cross-Origin Embedder Policy' (COEP)?
options: Ensuring all resources are loaded from the same origin or opted in

expert.question: What is 'Speculation-Based Attacks' (e.g., Spectre) on web?
options: Vulnerabilities allowing reading of sensitive data from memory

expert.question: What is 'Site Isolation' in browsers?
options: Security feature that puts each site in its own sandbox process

expert.question: What is 'Pre-rendering' vs 'Prerender-to-HTML'?
options: Generating full page snapshots vs just static skeletons

expert.question: What is 'Hydration Overlay'?
options: A visual indicator of where hydration failed or occurred

expert.question: What is 'Partial Hydration'?
options: Hydrating only specific parts of a page while leaving others static

expert.question: What is 'Progressive Hydration'?
options: Hydrating components over time based on priority or visibility

expert.question: What is 'Turing Complete' CSS?
options: The theoretical fact that CSS (with HTML) can perform any calculation

expert.question: What is 'CSS Typed OM'?
options: Exposing CSS values as typed JS objects instead of strings

expert.question: What is 'Animation Worklet'?
options: A way to run complex animations at the browser's native frame rate

expert.question: What is 'Scroll-Linked Animations'?
options: Animations that are driven by the scroll position natively

expert.question: What is 'Subgrid' in CSS Grid?
options: A way for nested grids to inherit the track definition of the parent

expert.question: What is 'Color Space' (LCH, OKLCH)?
options: Mathematical models for representing color beyond sRGB

expert.question: What is 'Tree-based Reconciliation'?
options: Algorithm to efficiently update the UI tree

expert.question: What is 'Double Buffering' in rendering?
options: Technique to reduce flicker by drawing to a back buffer first

expert.question: What is 'FCP' (Flash of Content)?
options: Unintentional display of unstyled or placeholder content

expert.question: What is 'Mutation Observer'?
options: A way to watch for changes being made to the DOM tree

expert.question: What is 'Performance Timeline API'?
options: Browsers' API to access performance-related events

expert.question: What is 'Main-thread Blocking'?
options: Long-running JS that prevents the UI from being responsive
